page.title: 06Yetholm Community Council
page.content: The Community Council was inaugurated in 1977 and consists of 11 members representing 660 electors. It is exceptional for a rural Council in Roxburgh District as this area is split into 4 wards:- Ward A (Bowmont Water) 2 seats, Ward B (Kirk Yetholm & Landward) 3 seats, Ward C (Cherrytrees to Hoselaw) 1 seat and Ward D (Yetholm) 5 seats. The Council works closely & actively with Regional & District Councillors each on the C.C. and covers many aspects of local government:- roads, conservation, planning, public transport, rights of way, council housing, recreation & tourism. A long campaign ended in the location of a Public Toilet in Kirk Yetholm, new footpaths between the villages have been completed and the Council took an active part to ensure the school stays open.
